text: Oil and Natural Gas Ltd. beat analyst estimates in the June quarter despite registering an over 20 percent decline in both profit and sales. Net profit declined 21.2 percent  to Rs 4,232.5 crore from Rs 5,368.4 crore in the corresponding period last year, according to the government owned company’s exchange filing. The consensus of analyst estimates tracked by Bloomberg stood at Rs 3,645 crore.Revenue declined 21.5 percent to Rs 17,670 crore from Rs 22,498.8 crore in the same quarter last year. The Bloomberg consensus estimate stood at Rs 18,432 crore.
title: ONGC’s  Profit Falls 21%, But Margins Improve
